results.title: Flowers
results.brief_description:
The third music video / visual from iyla’s 2019 EP, the video ironically uses hypersaturated flowers to comment on the stereotypes of traditional male/female relationships.

Director/DP/Editor: Patrick “Embryo” Tapu

constellations_other.name: Flower on the wind
constellations_other.description: Explore the use of flowers in the moving image as an aesthetic and metaphor.

results.title: Flower lovers
results.brief_description: A flower seller’s revengeful idea of selling explosive flowers has unforeseen consequences for the community. A well produced animated film.

results.title: Florence: cradle of the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Leah Joy and Museum Television Workshop
results.brief_description: Narrated by Grace Jackman, with poetry and readings inspired by Florence, and read by Richard Levine, viewers are taken on an artistic travelogue of Florence, focusing primarily on the Renaissance. This commentary provides insight into the architectural and artistic wonders which are an integral part of Florence. From 1436 when Brunelleschi designed the dome of Santa Maria del Fiore, the next hundred years of the Renaissance were filled with seminal figures like Michelangelo, Botticelli, Ghiberti, Cellini, Donatello and Leonardo da Vinci; overlooked by the great patrons Cosimo and Lorenzo de Medici. This video enables the viewer to experience the masterpieces of Florence as an armchair traveller.

results.title: Floor management
results.creator_credit: Peter Combes and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Demonstrates techniques of floor management in television production, showing application to an actual rehearsal. Bob Holness interviews Colin Dudley, a floor manager of considerable experience.

results.title: Flood
results.creator_credit: Department of Defence, Canberra and Natural Disasters Organisation (Australia)
results.brief_description: Describes floods and their causes all around Australia. Uses archival footaage (1970s) of flooding in Melbourne (Elizabeth Street), Brisbane and Narrabin. Addresses rural and urban flooding and offers advice to property buyers to check flooding potential before buying. Includes interviews with flood survivors and professionals and describes how weather bureaus can forecast flooding. The message is: Beware! Be prepared!

results.title: Floating in the Falling Universe of Flowers
results.brief_description:
Created in 2016-18, Floating in the Falling Universe of Flowers is an interactive digital installation by Japanese collective teamlab.

‘A seasonal year of flowers bloom and change with time, life spreads out into the universe.

Lie down or sit still in the space and eventually your body floats and you dissolve into the artwork world.

The artwork is rendered in real time by a computer. It is neither prerecorded nor on loop. Interaction between the viewer and the installation causes continuous change in the artwork.

Flowers grow, bud, bloom, and in time, the petals fall, and the flowers wither and die. The cycle of birth and death continues for perpetuity.

The universe at this moment in time can never be seen again.’ teamlab

results.title: Floating free. The Magic rolling board. Log driver's waltz
results.brief_description: Floating free (prod., dir. Jerry Butts): Depicts the skill and virtuosity involved in the 1977 World Frisbee Championships. “The Magic rolling board” (prod., dirs. Jim Freeman, Greg McGillvray): A skateboarding extravaganza which captures every expression of the sport. “Log driver’s waltz”: A short cartoon dedicated to the graceful Canadian log driver.

results.title: Flipper the seal
results.brief_description: One of a series of films produced as a background for reading and expression. Following a visit to a zoo, one of the young visitors decides to learn more about seals. While he reads such words as “waves”, “swimming”, “dive” and “fur”, seals are shown in their natural surroundings swimming, playing and caring for their young. Other activities, such as clay modelling and writing a story about seals, are suggested as a class project.

results.title: Flight: a new awareness
results.brief_description: As young people fly with hang gliders and a pilot soars upwards in a glider plane, the pilot reflects on how despite the earth’s many wonders - humans have always envied the birds and longed to fly. Soaring higher and higher, the pilot experiences an exhilarating freedom and a whole new perspective of the earth below. The earth becomes a single, living organism - more beautiful than he ever imagined. He discovers how fragile a hold life has on this planet and dreams of a technology that refines and perfects, rather than destroys and pollutes.
